All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class DateChooserX
extends javax.swing.JDialog

DateChooser creates a calendar input dialog, that avoid you to set easily the date.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

DateChooserX

public DateChooserX(java.awt.Frame parent,
                    boolean modal,
                    java.lang.String title,
                    int oriYear,
                    int oriMonth)
Create the calendar input dialog.

Parameters:
parent - the Frame to be parent to.
modal - if true makes the calendar input dialog modal.
title - the string to be showed as title of the calendar input dialog.
oriYear - Set the starting year (0 for current year).
oriMonth - Set the starting month (Current month=0, Jan=1, Feb=2, ..., Dec=12).

Return the selected date into the format dd/mm/yyyy

getSelectedDateMysql

public java.lang.String getSelectedDateMysql()
Return the selected date into the format yyyy-mm-dd, useful for MySQL query.

Returns:
the selected date like yyyy-mm-dd, without leading zeroes, useful for MySQL query.
